text.text:
This is not an actual workflow, it just contains a collection of custom actions that are meant to be saved as presets.

Running this won't do anything because of the following 'Stop' action.

parameters.__custom_action_script__:
import workflow
import webbrowser
from urllib import quote

params = workflow.get_parameters()

account = params.get('Account', None)
tweet = params.get('Tweet', None)
callback = params.get('Return to Editorial', False)

#tweetbot://<screenname>/post?text=<text>&callback_url=<url>&in_reply_to_status_id=<tweet_id>

if tweet:
	url = 'tweetbot://'
	if account:
		url += quote(account)
	url += '/post?text=' + quote(tweet)
	if callback:
		url += '&callback_url=' + quote('editorial://')
	webbrowser.open(url)

parameters.__custom_action_script__:
#NOTE: Drafts doesn't support a 'success' callback URL when no action is triggered, so if 'Return to Editorial' is on, the text is also copied to the clipboard.

import workflow
import webbrowser
from urllib import quote

params = workflow.get_parameters()
text = params.get('Text', None)
callback = params.get('Return to Editorial', False)

if text:
	url = 'drafts://x-callback-url/create?text=' + quote(text)
	if callback:
		url += '&action=' + quote('Copy to Clipboard')
		url += '&x-success=' + quote('editorial://')
	success = webbrowser.open(url)
	if not success:
		import console
		console.hud_alert('Drafts not installed', 'error', 1.5)

parameters.__custom_action_script__:
# To get a developer token, visit
# https://www.evernote.com/api/DeveloperToken.action
import workflow
import console

params = workflow.get_parameters()
auth_token = params.get('Dev Token', None)
note_title = params.get('Title', '')
note_content = params.get('Content', '')

if not auth_token:
	console.hud_alert('Evernote Dev Token Missing', 'error', 2.0)
	workflow.stop()
elif note_title or note_content:
	import evernote.edam.userstore.constants as UserStoreConstants
	import evernote.edam.type.ttypes as Types
	from evernote.api.client import EvernoteClient
	from xml.sax.saxutils import escape
	
	client = EvernoteClient(token=auth_token, sandbox=False)
	note_store = client.get_note_store()
	
	# To create a new note, simply create a new Note object and fill in
	# attributes such as the note's title.
	note = Types.Note()
	note.title = note_title
	note.content = '<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>'
	note.content += '<!DOCTYPE en-note SYSTEM ' \
    '"http://xml.evernote.com/pub/enml2.dtd">'
	note.content += '<en-note>'
	note.content += escape(note_content)
	note.content += '</en-note>'
	
	# Finally, send the new note to Evernote using the createNote method
	# The new Note object that is returned will contain server-generated
	# attributes such as the new note's unique GUID.
	created_note = note_store.createNote(note)
	console.hud_alert('Note Created', 'success', 1.5)

parameters.__custom_action_script__:
# http://api.duckduckgo.com/?q=define+ostensibly&format=json&pretty=1

import workflow
import console
import requests
import json
from urllib import quote
params = workflow.get_parameters()
term = params.get('Define', '')
if term:
	try:
		url = 'http://api.duckduckgo.com/?q=define+' + quote(term) + '&format=json'
		r = requests.get(url)
		d = json.loads(r.text)
		definition = d.get('Definition', None)
		if definition:
			workflow.set_output(definition)
		else:
			console.hud_alert('No Definition Found', 'error', 1.5)
	except:
		console.hud_alert('Definition Request Failed', 'error', 1.5)

parameters.__custom_action_script__:
import workflow
import console

params = workflow.get_parameters()
url = params.get('Feed URL', None)

if url:
	console.show_activity()
	import feedparser
	feed = feedparser.parse(url)
	entries = feed.get('entries', None)
	if not entries:
		entries = feed.get('articles', None)
	output_list = []
	if entries:
		for entry in entries:
			output_list.append(entry['title'])
	console.hide_activity()
	output = '\n'.join(output_list)
	workflow.set_output(output)

parameters.__custom_action_script__:
import workflow
import editor
import re

start, end = editor.get_selection()
text = editor.get_text()
params = workflow.get_parameters()
term = params.get('Select Next Occurrence of', '')
wrap = params.get('Wrap Around', False)
regex = params.get('Regular Expression', False)
pattern = term if regex else re.escape(term)

if term and text:
	match = re.search(pattern, text[end:])
	offset = end
	if not match and wrap:
		match = re.search(pattern, text)
		offset = 0
	if match:
		editor.set_selection(match.start(0) + offset, match.end(0) + offset)

parameters.__custom_action_script__:
import workflow
import urllib
s = workflow.get_parameters().get('Symbol')
if s:
	try:
		url = 'http://finance.yahoo.com/d/quotes.csv?s=' + s + '&f=l1'
		f = urllib.urlopen(url)
		price = f.read()
		workflow.set_output(price)
	except IOError:
		import console
		console.hud_alert('Could not get stock price', 'error', 1.5)

parameters.__custom_action_script__:
#coding: utf-8
import workflow
import notification
import console

sounds = ['Beep', 'Bleep', 'Coin_1', 'Error', 'Spaceship']
params = workflow.get_parameters()
effect_index = params['Sound']
effect_name = sounds[effect_index - 1] if effect_index > 0 else None
message = params['Text']
launch_url = params['Launch URL (optional)']

try:
	delay = float(params['Delay (Minutes)'])
except ValueError:
	console.hud_alert('Invalid Delay', 'error')
notification.schedule(message, delay * 60, effect_name, launch_url)
console.hud_alert('Scheduled', 'success', 1.0)

parameters.__custom_action_script__:
#coding: utf-8
import workflow
import difflib
from StringIO import StringIO

def diff(a, b, del1, del2, ins1, ins2):
	seq = difflib.SequenceMatcher(None, a, b)
	opcodes = seq.get_opcodes()
	out = StringIO()
	for op, a0, a1, b0, b1 in opcodes:
		if op == 'equal':
			out.write(a[a0:a1])
		if op == 'insert' or op == 'replace':
			out.write(ins1 + b[b0:b1] + ins2)
		if op == 'delete' or op == 'replace':
			out.write(del1 + a[a0:a1] + del2)
	return out.getvalue()

params = workflow.get_parameters()
a = params['Text A']
b = params['Text B']
if params['Output Format'] == 0:
	import cgi
	a = cgi.escape(a)
	b = cgi.escape(b)
	html = diff(a, b, '<del>', '</del>', '<ins>', '</ins>')
	workflow.set_output(html)
else:
	critic_markup = diff(a, b, '{--', '--}', '{++', '++}')
	workflow.set_output(critic_markup)
